channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: Assign a role to an Intune administrator - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to assign a built-in or custom role to a user in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Prerequisites the Microsoft Tunnel VPN for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the prerequisites for installation and use of the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway. These include Linux servers, network, and firewall configurations.

item.title: Microsoft Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Security Copilot Vulnerability Remediation Agent in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to set up and use the Vulnerability Remediation Agent for Security Copilot in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Configure Platform SSO for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure Platform SSO and deploy the configuration to your macOS devices. Platform SSO enables single sign-on (SSO) using Microsoft Entra ID with the Secure Enclave, smart card, or password authentication methods. You create a settings catalog policy to configure the settings. This article is a step-by-step guide to configure Platform SSO for macOS devices using Intune.

item.title: Create a policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure thousands of settings for Windows 10/11, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android client devices, including Microsoft Office apps, Microsoft Edge, and more. Add these settings in a device configuration profile to secure devices, and control different programs and features. Use Microsoft Copilot to get What If analysis, and learn more about each setting.

item.title: Assign device profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to assign device configuration profiles and policies to users and devices. Learn how to exclude groups from a profile assignment in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use ADMX templates on Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Administrative templates in Microsoft Intune to create groups of settings for Windows 10/11 client devices. Use these settings in a device configuration profile. You can control Office programs, Microsoft Edge, access OneDrive, use remote desktop, enable Auto-Play, set power management settings, use HTTP printing, control user sign-in, and change the event log size.

item.title: Properties catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure Properties catalog policy to manage Device Inventory settings on Windows devices you manage with Intune.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune to import and analyze group policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Import and analyze your group policy objects using the Group Policy analytics tool. See the policies that are supported and aren't supported in Intune.

item.title: Configure Universal Print policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to create a Universal Print policy for Windows 10/11 client devices. The policy automatically installs printers on your managed devices.

item.title: Configure device configuration profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or configure a device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune. Select the platform type, configure the settings, and add a scope tag. Learn more about applicability rules, and the policy refresh cycle times.

item.title: Configure macOS Enterprise SSO app extension with MDMs - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the Microsoft Enterprise single sign-on (SSO) app extension plug-in. Add or create an macOS device profile using the SSO app extension in Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro, and other MDM solution providers.

item.title: Restrict devices features using policy in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a device configuration profile to restrict features on Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, AOSP, macOS, iOS, iPadOS, and Windows 10/11 client devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create a Wi-Fi profile for devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the steps to create a Wi-Fi device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune. Create profiles for Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, Android kiosk, iOS, iPadOS, macOS, Windows 10/11, and Windows Holographic for Business. Use these profiles to create a WiFi connection to use certificates, choose an EAP type, select an authentication method, enable a proxy, and more.

item.title: Shared or multi-user Windows device settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add and use Windows 10/11 and Windows Holographic for Business devices that are shared, or used by multiple users in Microsoft Intune. See a list of all the settings and what they do on the devices, including Microsoft HoloLens. Control guest accounts, manage accounts and delete inactive accounts, allow or prevent saving to local storage, set power and sleep options, choose when updates are installed, and use devices in education environments in a device configuration profile.

item.title: Device features and settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Overview of the different Microsoft Intune device profiles. Get info on GPO, features, restrictions, email, wifi, VPN, education, certificates, upgrade Windows 10/11, BitLocker and Microsoft Defender, administrative templates, and custom device configuration settings in the Microsoft Intune admin center. Use these profiles to manage and protect data and devices in your company.

item.title: Update Windows BIOS using configuration MDM policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the BIOS configuration profile that can manage traditional BIOS settings in Microsoft Intune. You use an OEM tool to create a configuration file with the settings. You deploy an OEM Win32 app to the devices to read the configuration file and BIOS passwords. Then, you create a BIOS configuration policy in Intune to add the configuration file and assign the policy to your devices.

item.title: Add VPN settings to devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: On Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and Windows devices, use built-in settings to create virtual private network (VPN) connections in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Migrate your imported group policy to a policy in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: After you import your Windows group policy objects in Microsoft Intune, use the migrate feature to transfer your GPOs to a Settings Catalog policy. This policy uses your imported GPOs, and can be assigned to users and devices managed by your organizations.

item.title: Kiosk settings for Windows and Holographic devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure your Windows 10/11 and Windows Holographic for Business devices as single-app and multi-app kiosks, customize the start menu, add apps, show the task bar, and configure a web browser in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: See device configuration policies with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See and manage the device configuration policy details in Microsoft Intune. Look at a graphical chart of the number of devices assigned to a policy, and see which devices have policies assigned or deployed. Can also troubleshoot policies that have conflict settings.

item.title: Set up per-app VPN for iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the prerequisites, create a group for the virtual private network (VPN) users, add a SCEP certificate profile, configure a per-app VPN profile, and assign some apps to the VPN profile in Microsoft Intune on iOS/iPadOS devices. Also lists the steps to verify the VPN connection on the device.

item.title: Import Wi-Fi settings for Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Export Wi-Fi settings from a Windows device as an XML file using the network shell (netsh wlan) command. Then, import this file in Intune to create a Wi-Fi profile for devices running Windows 10/11 and Windows Holographic for Business.

item.title: Create iOS/iPadOS or macOS device profile with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create an iOS, iPadOS, or macOS device profile. Configure settings for AirPrint, layout of the home screen, app notifications, shared device, single sign-on, and web content filter settings in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create Wi-Fi profile with preshared key in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use a custom profile to create a Wi-Fi profile with a preshared key (PSK), and get sample XML code for Android, Android Enterprise, Windows, and EAP-based Wi-Fi profiles in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Update Windows BIOS features using DFCI MDM policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the Device Firmware Configuration Interface (DFCI) profile to manage UEFI settings in Microsoft Intune. To use DFCI profiles, create Microsoft Entra security groups, the Windows Autopilot deployment profile, and the Enrollment State Page profile.

item.title: Set permissions to Managed Home Screen using Android Enterprise OEMConfig - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add the Samsung Knox Service Plugin, Zebra OEMConfig Powered by MX, and Legacy Zebra OEMConfig apps to Intune, and use the app schemas to configure permissions for the Managed Home Screen (MHS) app on Android Enterprise devices.

item.title: eSIM configuration of a download server - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about configuration of an eSIM Download Server from Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure 802.1x wired network settings for macOS and Windows devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create or add a wired network device configuration profile or policy using the IEEE 802.1X standard for macOS, Windows 10, and Windows 11 devices and computers. See the different settings, add certificates, choose an EAP type, and select an authentication method in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add custom settings to iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Export iOS and iPadOS settings from Apple Configurator or Apple Profile Manager tools, and then import these settings into Microsoft Intune. These settings can create, use, and control custom settings and features on iOS/iPadOS devices. This custom profile can then be assigned or distributed to iOS/iPadOS devices in your organization to create a baseline or standard.

item.title: Create macOS system and kernel extensions with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about system extensions and kernel extensions for macOS devices. In Microsoft Intune, add or create a device configuration policy that configures kernel extensions. In the extension, you can allow user override, add a team identifier, and add a bundle and team identifier.

item.title: Deploy OEMConfig profiles to Zebra devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to create and deploy multiple OEMConfig device configuration profiles on Zebra devices running Android Enterprise. Use Zebra actions and steps to order your profiles.

item.title: Create an email device profile for iOS/iPadOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Microsoft Intune to create an email device profile so iOS/iPadOS devices can securely connect to company organization email.

item.title: Allow or block apps for Samsung Knox Standard devices
item.description: Create a custom profile to allow and block apps for Samsung Knox Standard Android device administrator devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Custom per-app VPN profile for Android DA in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use a custom profile for per-app VPN profiles on Android device administrator with the Pulse Secure or Citrix VPN connection types in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Windows Defender Application Control on HoloLens 2 devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure the Windows Defender Application Control (WDAC) CSP to allow or block apps from opening on HoloLens 2 devices in Microsoft Intune. Use PowerShell and a custom configuration profile.

item.title: Add or configure education settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Take a Test app in a device configuration profile on Windows devices in Microsoft Intune. Create a configuration profile using the Education settings, and enter a test app URL, choose how users sign-in, monitor the screen during the test, and allow or prevent text suggestions during the test.

item.title: Add custom settings to Linux devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add Bash scripts to create a custom Linux profile in Microsoft Intune. Use the script to create, use, and control custom settings and features on Linux devices. This custom profile can then be assigned or distributed to Linux devices in your organization to create a baseline or standard.

item.title: Enable eSIM data connections in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or use eSIM to get internet and data access using different data plans. In Intune, add or import activation codes, and then assign these activation codes using a configuration profile. You can also monitor the eSIM profiles and check the status of the eSIM-enabled devices.

item.title: Common tasks and features in the settings catalog - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure common features. You can create a Universal Print policy, configure Microsoft Edge and Google Chrome web browsers, and use built in settings instead of plist files for macOS devices.

item.title: Update Microsoft 365 apps with the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to update Microsoft 365 apps to the latest version, and choose how frequently Office checks for updates. See the device registry keys that are updated when an Intune policy to Office update is applied.

item.title: Restrict USB devices using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to restrict USB devices, including thumb drives, flash drives, USB cameras, and more. Use other settings to allow specific USB devices on Windows 10/11 devices.

item.title: Windows Delivery Optimization settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure device configuration policy to manage Delivery Optimization settings on Windows devices you manage with Intune.

item.title: Upgrade Windows editions or switch S mode using Intune policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to upgrade Windows 10/11 client devices to a different edition, or switch S mode. Administrators can use a device configuration profile to upgrade Windows client Professional to Windows client Enterprise, and switch out of S mode. See the supported upgrade paths for Windows 10/11 Pro, N Edition, Education, Cloud, Enterprise, Core, and Holographic.

item.title: Questions with policies and profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Common questions, answers, and scenarios with device policies and profiles in Microsoft Intune. Learn more about profile changes not applying to users or devices, how long it takes for new policies to deploy, which settings apply when there are conflicts, what happens when you delete or remove a profile, and more.

item.title: Import custom and third-party partner ADMX templates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: You can add, upload, or import custom and third-party partner ADMX and ADML files in Microsoft Intune. When they're imported, create a device configuration profile and assign the profile to your Windows 10/11 client devices.

item.title: Single sign-on (SSO) for iOS/iPadOS and macOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Overview of Microsoft Enterprise SSO plug-in in Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro, and other MDM solution providers. The Enterprise SSO plug-in is available on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices.

item.title: Add custom settings for Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create a custom profile to use the OMA-URI settings for devices running Windows 10/11 client in Microsoft Intune. Use a custom profile to add custom settings.

item.title: Use Zebra Mobility Extensions on Android devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage and use Zebra devices running Android with Zebra Mobility Extensions (MX). See all the steps, including install the Company Portal app, sideload the app, assign device administrator role, create a StageNow profile, and more.

item.title: Use OEMConfig on Android Enterprise devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage and use devices running Android Enterprise with OEMConfig. See all the steps, including an overview, see the prerequisites, create the configuration profile in Intune, and see a list of supported OEMConfig apps.

item.title: Add preference file settings to macOS devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add an xml or plist file that includes key information about your app. Use a preference file device configuration profile to change key information in the property list file, and assign it to your macOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deploy Microsoft Edge policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create settings using the settings catalog to configure Microsoft Edge on Windows and macOS devices. Using Microsoft Intune, you can configure group policy settings, and deploy these settings to Microsoft Edge users.

item.title: Add custom settings to macOS devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Import custom macOS settings into Microsoft Intune. These settings can create, use, and control custom settings and features on macOS devices. This custom profile can then be assigned or distributed to macOS devices in your organization to create a baseline or standard.

item.title: Configure email settings in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create an email device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune, and deploy this profile to Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, iOS, iPadOS, and Windows devices. Use email profiles to configure common email settings, including a Microsoft Exchange email server. Add authentication methods to connect to corporate email on devices you manage.

item.title: Walkthrough-Create a settings catalog policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This tutorial or walkthrough steps through creating and comparing an on-premises Administrative Templates (ADMX) Group Policy and Microsoft Intune cloud-based settings catalog policy. It shows similar settings in on-premises and the Intune settings catalog to create and manage policies for Office, Windows, and Microsoft Edge on Windows 10/11 client devices.

item.title: Create a Windows Network Boundary profile in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a Windows Network Boundary policy to Windows devices using Microsoft Intune. Add trusted sites, trusted domains, IPv4 and IPv6 ranges, and proxy servers to a device configuration policy. Microsoft Defender Application Guard in Microsoft Edge trusts sites in this boundary.

item.title: Platform SSO scenarios for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure common Platform SSO scenarios for macOS devices. You can enable Kerberos SSO to on-premises Active Directory and cloud-based Microsoft Entra ID, use Touch ID biometric policy with Secure Enclave authentication, and enable SSO on non-Microsoft apps. You can also configure end user experience settings.

item.title: Create a Windows Health Monitoring profile in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a Windows Health Monitoring profile to collect endpoint analytics and software update events on Windows 10/11 devices in Microsoft Intune. Use this data to recommend software, review startup performance, and fix support issues.

item.title: Use StageNow logs on Android Zebra devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See common issues and resolutions when using StageNow on Android devices with Microsoft Intune. Also learn how to get logs, and see examples of how to read the logs for success or errors.

item.title: Domain join profile settings for Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a domain join device configuration profile for Microsoft Entra hybrid joined devices. Use this profile to deploy on-premises Active Directory domain information to devices provisioned with Windows Autopilot and Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use custom device settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create a profile to use custom settings for Windows 10/11 client, Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, macOS, and iOS/iPadOS devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure iOS/iPadOS Enterprise SSO app extension with MDMs - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the Microsoft Enterprise single sign-on (SSO) plug-in. Add or create an iOS or iPadOS device configuration profile using the Microsoft Enterprise SSO plug-in app extension in Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro, and other MDM solution providers.

item.title: Add custom settings to Android DA devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create a custom profile for Android device administrator (DA) devices in Microsoft Intune. Create a WiFi profile with a preshared key, create a per-app VPN profile, or allow/block apps for Samsung Knox Standard devices.

item.title: App protection policies overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Microsoft Intune app protection policies help protect your company data and prevent data loss.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS app protection policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the iOS/iPadOS app protection policy (APP) settings for iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension for Windows.

item.title: Manage Apple volume-purchased apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync apps you bought in volume through Apple Business Manager with Microsoft Intune. Then manage and track these apps on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices.

item.title: Planning guide to move to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Plan, design, implement, adopt, and move to Microsoft Intune. Get guidance and advice to determine goals, use-case scenarios and requirements, and create rollout and communication plans, support, testing, and validation plans.

item.title: Add Microsoft 365 Apps to Windows 10/11 devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Intune to install Microsoft 365 apps on Windows 10/11 devices.

item.title: Assign apps to groups in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to assign an Intune app to groups of users or devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: App configuration policies for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use app configuration policies on an iOS/iPadOS or Android device in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Android app protection policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This topic describes the app protection policy settings for Android devices.

item.title: Add Win32 app supersedence - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Win32 app supersedence with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Troubleshoot Win32 apps in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the most common methods to troubleshoot Win32 app issues with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add a Windows line-of-business app to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add a Windows line-of-business (LOB) app using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manually add the Windows 10 Company Portal app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how your workforce can manually add the Windows 10 Company Portal app to their PC from the Microsoft Store.

item.title: Windows app deployment by using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Windows 10/11 app deployment scenarios available with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add web apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding web apps (client-server applications) to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use shell scripts on macOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create, assign, monitor, and troubleshoot shell scripts for macOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add app configuration policies for managed Android Enterprise devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use app configuration policies in Microsoft Intune to supply settings when users run a Managed Google Play app.

item.title: Join your cloud-native endpoints to Microsoft Entra - Microsoft Intune
item.description: When moving to or using cloud-native endpoints, use Microsoft Entra joined endpoints. When your endpoints are joined to Microsoft Entra, you can use Windows Autopilot to provision or get devices ready for organization use. Learn more about the benefits to IT admins and end-users.

item.title: Using Azure Virtual Desktop single-session with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidelines for using Azure Virtual Desktop single-session with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add an unmanaged macOS PKG app to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about how to add an unmanaged macOS PKG app to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Data protection for Windows MAM - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable protected MAM access to org data using Windows MAM.

item.title: Include and exclude app assignments in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Intune to include and exclude app assignments.

item.title: Add iOS store apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding iOS store apps to Microsoft Intune. You can assign apps using this method if the apps are free of charge in the App Store.

item.title: Add and assign an app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you'll use Microsoft Intune to add and assign an app.

item.title: Using Windows virtual machines with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the general guidelines for using Windows 10/11 virtual machines with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Policies for Microsoft 365 apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand the policies available for Microsoft 365 apps.

item.title: Manage Microsoft 365 (Office) for iOS and Android with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune app protection and configuration policies with Microsoft 365 (Office) for iOS and Android to ensure collaboration experiences are always accessed with safeguards in place.

item.title: Configuration policies for Intune App SDK managed apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to configure policies for Intune App SDK managed apps.

item.title: Add Android store apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add Android store apps from the Google Play store to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Understanding Microsoft Intune management agent for macOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Microsoft Intune management agent for macOS.

item.title: Mobile Application Management (MAM) and Android Enterprise personally-owned work profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the available features when deciding to use Mobile Application Management (MAM) and/or Android Enterprise personally-owned work profiles for personal or BYOD Android devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Google Chrome for Android devices using Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune configuration policies with Google Chrome for Android devices.

item.title: Get app bundle ID - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get the app bundle ID in Microsoft Intune for Android, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Windows apps. Use the bundle ID in your app policies, device configuration profiles, enrollment policies, and compliance policies in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Understand app protection policy delivery and timing - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the different deployment windows for app protection policies to understand when changes should appear on your end user devices.

item.title: Add Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to macOS devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to macOS devices using Microsoft Intune.
